//Simon
Simon was created by Suzanne Kersten and Harrison Welch for their CSCI 4020 class, taught by the esteemed Dr. Nicholson.
Menu Ping - qubodup
 Correct Ping - edsward
 Falling rock sound (in-game button) - Uminari
 Laser sound (in-game button) - THE_bizniss
 Camera Click (in-game button) - Snapper4298
 Car Door Closing (in-game button) - Heigh-hoo
 Wrong Voice Clip - troym1
 Main Menu background - geralt
 Game background - Wuzzy
Return to Main Menu
Upon starting a game, Simon will start a pattern by lighting up one of the four colored buttons and playing a sound unique to that button. Your goal is to match that pattern that Simon plays, with each correct sequence adding another button to the end of the sequence. 

Example: If Simon lights up the blue button, you press the blue button. Then Simon lights up blue button and the red button, so you press the blue button and the red button in that order, continuing on until you make a mistake in the sequence. 

Your score at the end is however many buttons were in the last sequence successfully completed.
Same as original Simon, but with two buttons added to the sequence each time instead of one! Are you sure you can keep up? Recommended for those with experience in PERL programming!
Instead of repeating the sequence, you have to play the sequence back in reverse! Tricky tricky! Recommended for those looking for a challenge.
